p: Various stress factors such as nutrient depletion on the algae trigger neutral lipid accumulation. This leads to a slower growing or even contracting overall biomass, but an increase in oil production (James and Boriah 2010). The maximum lipid production by C. salina was found to be 28.26 and 37.53 % dry weight for nitrogen-repleted and -depleted conditions, respectively, whereas for N. oculata the maximum lipid production was found to be 33.18 and 54.26 % dry weight nitrogen-repleted and -depleted conditions, respectively.
